page.title: 17BIOGRAPHY, SHOP KEEPER
page.content: THE LADY IN THE BIG VILLAGE SHOP TOLD US THAT SHE HAD LIVED IN NORMANS BAY FOR 50 YEARS, WHEN HER MOTHER HAD THE SHOP BUILT. THERE HAD BEEN A FEW CHANGES, LIKE A FEW MORE HOUSES, A CARAVAN PARK AND ABOUT SEVEN YEARS AGO THE OLD CHURCH WAS PULLED DOWN. SHE LIKES NORMANS BAY BECAUSE IT IS QUIET AND THE PEOPLE ARE FRIENDLY. IN THE 1939-45 WAR THE ARMY TOOK OVER ALL OF NORMANS BAY. THE SHOP WAS USED AS THEIR CANTEEN, AND AT THE BACK WERE THEIR OFFICES. SHE HAD TO GO AWAY DURING THE WAR, AND WHEN SHE RETURNED THE SHOP WAS IN A TERRIBLE STATE. THERE WAS NO FURNITURE LEFT.ANOTHER LADY,MRS SMITH,HAD A SEARCH-LIGHT BUILT AT THE SIDE OF HER HOUSE DURING THE WAR. THE ROAD IS VERY BUMPY; IT IS PRIVATE, SO THEY HAVE A RESIDENTS ASSOCIATION TO RAISE MONEY FOR ITS UPKEEP. THEY CULTIVATE SEA KALE.
